arts.ttl: Manchester City vs. Manchester United: Bruno Fernandes surpasses Wayne Rooney's record with goal for Ruben Amorim
arts.sum: Bruno Fernandes is now Manchester United's leading goalscorer from the penalty spot in Premier League history, surpassing Wayne Rooney's record.

arts.ttl: Man Utd beat Man City with incredible late turnaround
arts.sum: The 22-year-old drew a rash tackle from Matheus Nunes to win a penalty that Bruno Fernandes converted in the 88th minute, before scoring himself from a tight angle with stoppage time looming to hand Ruben Amorim a memorable win. Yet again, Guardiola was left stunned on the sidelines as City failed to win for the sixth time in seven Premier League matches.

arts.ttl: Man City 1-2 Man United: Pep Guardiola makes worrying admission as champions set unwanted Premier League record
arts.sum: Pep Guardiola says that he is "not good enough" to solve Man City's mounting problems after watching his side concede two late goals and lose 2-1 to rivals Man United, setting an unwanted record in the process.

arts.ttl: Man City looking into Pogba move - Sunday's gossip
arts.sum: Manchester City weigh up a move for Paul Pogba, Newcastle United interested in West Ham's Mohammed Kudus, Bayern Munich rule out signing a Harry Kane replacement in January, plus more.

arts.ttl: Luckhurst Says 8/10 Star Was Man Utd's Best Player Behind Amad v Man City
arts.sum: It was a much-needed confidence boost for the 31-year-old, who has been tipped for an exit from Old Trafford in recent weeks.

arts.ttl: What Marcus Rashford did during Man United win vs Man City speaks volumes amid Ruben Amorim call
arts.sum: Manchester United news as Marcus Rashford reveals where he was for the derby after Ruben Amorim cuts him from the squad

arts.ttl: Pep Guardiola feels he is ‘not good enough’ after City’s late defeat by United
arts.athr: Jamie Jackson at the Etihad Stadium
arts.sum: Guardiola: ‘I have to find solutions and so far I haven’t’ Bernardo Silva says players ‘have to look at themselves’ Pep Guardiola said he is “not good enough” after Manchester City fell to a dramatic late derby defeat to Manchester United which extended their dire run to eight losses in 11 games. City led through Josko Gvardiol’s 36th-minute header but Matheus Nunes’s defensive lapse conceded an 88th-minute penalty, which Bruno Fernandes converted, before Amad Diallo’s winner just before the end of regulation time. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Manchester City 'played like UNDER-15s' in final stages against Man United, fumes Bernardo Silva - claiming Pep Guardiola's wounded stars got what they deserved
arts.sum: The faltering league champions have been incredibly fragile of late and they saw that exposed once more as a penalty from Bruno Fernandes and a 90th-minute winner from Amad Diallo.

arts.ttl: Man City player ratings vs Manchester United as calamitous Matheus Nunes blunder costly
arts.sum: Manchester City contrived to lose the derby by conceding twice in the final minutes

arts.ttl: Amad Diallo scores late winner as United stun City in Manchester derby
arts.sum: City were leading 1-0 with two minutes remaining.
